question.text: The process which makes a major difference between <math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants is:

solution.text: Photorespiration is present in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> plants but absent in <math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> plants minimize photorespiration by separating initial <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>C</mi><msub><mi>O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> fixation and the Calvin cycle by performing these steps in different cell types. This phenomenon occurs due to the RuBisCO enzyme's dual nature, which works on oxygenase activity if there is less carbon dioxide or more oxygen concentration.
